name: Nuisance Algae / Periphyton Indicator
functionStatement: Nitrogen and phosphorus transformations feed primary production, regulate excess loads, and store or release nutrients.
descriptionMarkdown: Algae suggests no excessive nutrients vs reference, unless historically moderate (open canopy).
howToMeasureMarkdown: Estimate periphyton or algal cover during a field visit and interpret with light and nutrients.

inputs.label: Nuisance Algae / Periphyton Indicator
inputs.helpMarkdown: High resolution aerial imagery; Field photos; Brief field recon; Historical evidence

levels.label: Good
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Good: No nuisance algae and <10% cover, or normal for region. (Suggested index range 0.70-1.0)

levels.label: Fair
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Fair: 10-30% cover or mild filaments. / 30-50% cover with partial blooms. (Suggested index range 0.40-0.69)

levels.label: Poor
levels.criteriaMarkdown: Poor: >50% cover or thick scums. (Suggested index range 0.0-0.39)

references: EPA Water Quality Portal (nutrients and chlorophyll where available)
